Peptidoglycan ( PGN ) , the major cell wall component of Gram - positive bacteria , induces secretion of cytokines in macrophages through <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the pattern recognition receptor that binds lipopolysaccharide and other microbial products .

To begin to elucidate the mechanisms that regulate the transcription of cytokine genes , we wanted to determine which transcription factors are activated by PGN in mouse RAW264.7 and human THP-1 macrophage cells .

Our results demonstrated that : ( i ) PGN induced phosphorylation of the transcription factors <extra_id_0> ATF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CREB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; ( ii ) <extra_id_0> ATF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CREB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> bound DNA as a dimer and induced transcriptional activation of a CRE reporter plasmid , which was inhibited by dominant negative <extra_id_0> CREB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> ATF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; ( iii ) PGN induced phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , protein synthesis of <extra_id_0> JunB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and transcriptional activation of the AP-1 reporter plasmid , which was inhibited by dominant negative <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; and ( iv ) PGN - induced activation of CREB / ATF and AP-1 was mediated through <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
This is the first study to demonstrate activation of CREB / ATF and AP-1 transcription factors by PGN or by any other component of Gram - positive bacteria .
